TRYOUTS CALLED FOR
ADAMS DEBATE
garland Hershey, president
of the Debating Council, has
announced that tryouts for the
Junior-Senior debate Will be
held todily and tomorrow at
12.20 in G. 112.
The Juniors will try out today, while the Seniors will
make their appearance tomorrow.
Each member of the winning team will be awarded fifteen dollars worth of books.
This prize is known as the
Adams award and should
bring many men, interested in
debating, out to show their
ability, in this line.

Y. M. C.'A. Cabinet the staff
of the 1929-30 ilandbook was
chosen. This is published by
the "Y" each year. It is more
generally known to the Campus as the "Freshman Bible."
The new staff consists of
Harold J. 13loom, Editor;
George H. Dowell, Business
Manager, and A. Pemberton
Johnson, Associate Editor.

TRYOUTS CALLED FOR
ADAMS DEBATE
garland Hershey, president
of the Debating Council, has
announced that tryouts for the
Junior-Senior debate Will be
held todily and tomorrow at
12.20 in G. 112.
The Juniors will try out today, while the Seniors will
make their appearance tomorrow.
Each member of the winning team will be awarded fifteen dollars worth of books.
This prize is known as the
Adams award and should
bring many men, interested in
debating, out to show their
ability, in this line.
